Three British companies fought it out and shaped this market over decades: Kellogg's, Weetabix and Jordans. Now they battle it out as modern consumers prioritise nutrition, while new, independent rivals with big ideas compete for their own place at the breakfast table

programme.desc: The historian investigates how the preserved city was found after it was buried under volcanic ash and pumice after the eruption of Mount Vesuvius in 79 AD, revealing how treasure hunters and archaeologists battled for centuries to uncover and sometimes plunder it. He retraces the amazing first finds hidden deep beneath the rock-hard volcanic debris, where miners burrowed 25 metres down to a theatre, and enters the spectacular gladiatorial arena, the discovery of which opened the floodgates to the excavation of Pompeii

With the help of the keepers, he works to restore the attraction to its former glory, while also trying to reconnect with his troubled teenage son. Fact-based comedy drama, starring Matt Damon, Scarlett Johansson and Thomas Haden Church

His adventures lead him to encounters with various characters from history - but none of them are quite what he had imagined. Terry Gilliam's fantasy comedy, starring Craig Warnock, David Rappaport, John Cleese, Michael Palin, Sean Connery, Ian Holm, Ralph Richardson and David Warner

programme.title: Stardust (2007)
programme.desc: A young shop assistant in Victorian England enters a magical parallel world in search of a fallen star to give to the girl of his dreams. However, the star in question is in fact a beautiful woman, who he helps flee from a wicked witch and a murderous prince. Fantasy adventure, based on Neil Gaiman's novel, with Charlie Cox, Claire Danes, Michelle Pfeiffer, Robert De Niro, Mark Strong and Sienna Miller. Narrated by Ian McKellen

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Fallout Interview Special
programme.desc: Stars Tom Cruise, Rebecca Ferguson, Henry Cavill, Simon Pegg, Vanessa Kirby and director Christopher McQuarrie talk about making the sixth instalment in the franchise

programme.title: A Knight's Tale (2001)
programme.desc: A poverty-stricken squire spies an opportunity to make his dreams come true when his employer dies. He takes his place as a knight, launching himself on the road to riches by competing in jousting tournaments, but his ruse is jeopardised by a dastardly nobleman. Comedy adventure, starring Heath Ledger, Paul Bettany, Mark Addy, Shannyn Sossamon and Rufus Sewell

programme.title: Clear and Present Danger (1994)
programme.desc: A CIA analyst gets caught up in the Colombian drug trade while trying to track down terrorists responsible for the murder of a close friend of the US president - but his investigations point to illegal activity and corruption at the very top of government. Action thriller, based on Tom Clancy's novel, with Harrison Ford reprising his role from Patriot Games alongside Willem Dafoe, Anne Archer and James Earl Jones

programme.title: Candyman (1992)
programme.desc: A graduate student is researching urban legends for her dissertation and investigates the tale of a supernatural, hook-handed serial killer rumoured to haunt a run-down Chicago apartment block. Though cynical at first, she soon finds herself face to face with the murderous soul, who sets his sights on claiming her as his latest victim. Horror, starring Virginia Madsen, Tony Todd and Xander Berkeley

programme.title: Don't Breathe (2016)
programme.desc: Three thieves break into the house of a blind Gulf War veteran, who is not as helpless as he seems and is also harbouring a dark secret. Horror, starring Stephen Lang, Jane Levy and Dylan Minnette

programme.title: Madagascar 3: Europe's Most Wanted (2012)
programme.desc: The escaped zoo animals continue their quest to get back to their New York home. Having made it to Monte Carlo, they join a circus on a European tour as a means of travelling undetected - but an animal control agent is in hot pursuit. Animated comedy, with the voices of Ben Stiller, Chris Rock, David Schwimmer and Jada Pinkett Smith

programme.title: Megamind (2010)
programme.desc: An evil genius finally succeeds in killing the superhero who has foiled his every evil scheme, but finds life without an enemy boring. To fill the gap, he transforms an ordinary man into a worthy adversary - but when his creation turns evil, it falls to the villain to save the world. Animated comedy, with the voices of Will Ferrell, Tina Fey and Brad Pitt

programme.title: Johnny English Strikes Again (2018)
programme.desc: A sinister cyber attack reveals the identity of all active undercover agents in Britain. Hapless secret agent Johnny English is sent on a mission to the South of France to protect Queen and country, and find the mastermind hacker responsible. Third movie in the comedy series, starring Rowan Atkinson, Ben Miller and Olga Kurylenko

programme.title: Junior (1994)
programme.desc: A fertility expert pioneers a treatment enabling men to become pregnant and carry babies to full term. When the authorities cancel funding for the research, he decides to test it on himself, but gives little thought to how difficult it will be to keep it a secret. The situation is further complicated when he starts to fall for the woman whose child he is carrying. Comedy, with Arnold Schwarzenegger, Danny DeVito, Emma Thompson and Frank Langella

programme.title: A Good Year (2006)
programme.desc: A city trader inherits a French vineyard from his deceased uncle. But when he goes to France to get a valuation on his newly acquired property so he can sell it, a series of unexpected events leads him to reassess his priorities in life. Ridley Scott's comedy drama based on Peter Mayle's novel, starring Russell Crowe, Albert Finney, Abbie Cornish and Marion Cotillard

programme.title: The Grey (2011)
programme.desc: Eight oil rig workers end up stranded in the middle of the Alaskan tundra when the plane flying them home crashes. With limited supplies, they must make a gruelling journey across the icy wilderness to civilisation, but their situation is made more perilous when a pack of ferocious wolves begins stalking them. Adventure, starring Liam Neeson, Frank Grillo and Dermot Mulroney

programme.title: The Predator (2018)
programme.desc: When a young boy accidentally signals the galaxy's most lethal hunters who set course for Earth, an eclectic band of former soldiers and a scientist attempt to prevent the end of the human race. Director Shane Black's fourth entry in the sci-fi thriller saga, starring Boyd Holbrook, Trevante Rhodes, Jacob Tremblay, Keegan-Michael Key and Olivia Munn

programme.title: Sea Fever (2019)
programme.desc: A shy, aspiring marine biologist and the crew of an Irish trawler run into an unseen object, and are soon marooned at sea. Before long, they are fighting for survival as they tackle a parasite in their water supply. Director Neasa Hardiman's thriller, starring Connie Nielsen, Dougray Scott and Hermione Corfield

programme.title: Getting Personal
programme.desc: In this episode of Getting Personal, Deepa meets Mary Whittaker to find out how she became Scotland's first Deaf BSL minister.

programme.title: Kung Fu Panda (2008)
programme.desc: A hero is needed to defend a peaceful valley community from attack by a rampaging snow leopard. The unlikely candidate for the job is a lazy panda, who enlists the aid of a legendary team of animal fighters and their wise master to teach him the martial arts skills he needs to fulfil his destiny. Animated comedy, with the voices of Jack Black, Dustin Hoffman, Angelina Jolie, Ian McShane and Jackie Chan

programme.title: Lemony Snicket's A Series of Unfortunate Events (2004)
programme.desc: Three orphans are entrusted into the care of their sinister uncle, a master of disguise who intends to kill them for the family fortune. Quickly realising he is up to no good, the children flee, moving from one prospective guardian to the next - but their wily relative is never far behind. Comedy adventure based on the children's books, starring Jim Carrey, Meryl Streep, Jude Law, Liam Aitken and Emily Browning, with Kara and Shelby Hoffman

programme.title: Jumanji (1995)
programme.desc: A man who has been trapped inside a mysterious jungle board game for 26 years is eventually freed when two children start to play it. Unfortunately, he arrives with a rampaging horde of animals on his heels, leaving only one solution - to finish the game he started all those years ago. Fantasy adventure, starring Robin Williams, Kirsten Dunst and Bonnie Hunt

programme.title: Zathura: A Space Adventure (2005)
programme.desc: Two squabbling brothers with time on their hands decide to play a mysterious old board game after finding it in their basement. A chance roll of the dice sends their house into deep space, where they must battle with aliens and work together to stay alive. Family sci-fi adventure, starring Josh Hutcherson, Jonah Bobo, Kristen Stewart, Tim Robbins and Dax Shepard

programme.title: Pacific Rim: Uprising (2018)
programme.desc: Ten years after the Pan Pacific Defense Corps unleashed an army of Jaegers - 25-storey tall robots operated by mind-melded humans - former pilot Jake Pentecost is contacted by estranged sister Mako Mori. She implores him to return to the PPDC to head off the threat posed by Liwen Shao, chief executive of Shao Industries, who intends to replace the Jaegers with unmanned drones. Haunted by ghosts of the past, Jake eventually agrees to mentor a 15-year-old cadet called Amara, whose family were crushed to death during one monster attack. Director Steven S DeKnight's literally blockbusting sci-fi sequel, starring John Boyega, Scott Eastwood and Cailee Spaeny

programme.title: Peppermint (2018)
programme.desc: LA banker Riley sets out on a one-woman vengeance mission after her husband and daughter are killed on the order of a powerful drug lord and the criminals escape punishment, but events spiral out of control. Revenge thriller, starring Jennifer Garner, Jeff Hephner and Juan Pablo Raba

programme.title: Colombiana (2011)
programme.desc: A 10-year-old Colombian girl witnesses the murder of her parents at the hands of gangsters, but is rescued by her uncle, who takes her to the US and raises her to be a cold-blooded killer. Years later, she is still working for him as an assassin, but is secretly planning to avenge her parents' deaths. Action thriller, starring Zoe Saldana, Cliff Curtis, Michael Vartan and Lennie James

programme.title: Brother (2000)
programme.desc: A Japanese gangster exiled to America forms an unholy alliance with his drug-dealing half brother, and the pair embark on a battle for LA's prime drug turf. Crime thriller, directed by and starring Takeshi Kitano, with Omar Epps and Claude Maki

programme.desc: Worried that her children are slipping away, Beverly takes on new responsibilities at William Penn. Murray struggles to work with Formica Mike

programme.title: Married at First Sight Australia

programme.desc: The family gathers at Jay's ahead of Alex's graduation and stays longer than intended. Jay tries to conceal a Botox slip-up, Cameron is angered by Mitch's tendency to laugh at his expense and Claire feels emotional about the rate her children are growing up

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Jay hopes for a quiet afternoon on the lake fishing, but his family has other plans involving fuss and thrills. Meanwhile, the children face the task of creatively editing their grandfather's birthday video

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The calamity-prone group visits a guest ranch where Mitch and Cam hope to rediscover their macho side, and a cowboy named Hank takes an instant shine to Gloria. Comedy, starring Ed O'Neill and Julie Bowen

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Mitch and Cam try to get Lily on their side when they decide to adopt a baby boy, but have doubts about whether they are adequately prepared to raise another child. Meanwhile, Gloria deals with Manny's head teacher

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Cam and Mitch go on diets, and Phil is inspired to try his hand at tightrope walking. Meanwhile, Claire tries to plant ideas in the heads of her warring daughters, and Jay's behaviour grates on Gloria

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny and Leonard announce that they are moving in together, prompting Sheldon to revisit 2003, a much simpler time before he had met either of them. Howard and Raj form a band to play at the comic-book store, only to fall out over musical differences

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The boys want to become more sporty, so Barry Kripke leads them in a fencing lesson, while Penny, Amy and Bernadette help Stuart, who wants to attract more female customers to the comic-book store

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: In the middle of a nationwide shortage of liquid helium, Sheldon and Leonard take desperate measures to obtain the supplies they need in order to prove a scientific theory before a rival team of researchers can beat them to it. Meanwhile, Penny and Bernadette download a dating app onto Amy's phone in order to find her a new boyfriend

programme.title: Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen (2009)
programme.desc: The war between the shape-shifting robots erupts once again, as the first of the evil Decepticons leads an attack on Earth to locate an ancient planet-destroying machine. Hapless teenager Sam Witwicky is caught in the middle of the ensuing conflict as he holds the key to discovering the location of the device. programme.title: Celebrity Gogglebox
programme.desc: Opinions on Cooking with the Stars, Too Hot to Handle, Only Connect, Jaws, Cat People, The Yorkshire Vet, Catfish UK: The TV Show, and BBC News - England Defeat. programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on April 2021 shows including Line of Duty, Snackmasters, Alan Carr's Epic Gameshow, Mastermind, Baby Surgeons: Delivering Miracles, The Art of the Joy of Sex and Dr Pimple Popper. programme.title: Naked Attraction

Jasmine Harman showcases the best their ¬£320,000 budget can offer in Kent, while Ben Hillman shows some stunning homes in Villamartin south of Costa Blanca for their budget of ¬£150,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Retired couple Elizabeth and Phillip want to make the most of their hard earned downtime by doing more of their favourite sports; skiing in winter and sailing in the summer. They've decided to sell the family home and buy two new properties - one near Ipswich Marina, which is perfect for sailing - and the other in Perpignan in France, with world class skiing just an hour away. Laura Hamilton delivers three fantastic homes in Ipswich for this sporty couple's budget of ¬£200,000 and Jasmine Harman finds three characterful properties in Perpignan for their ¬£120,000 French budget

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman and Laura Hamilton show Bev and Gary D'Cruz homes in the Cotswolds and Lanzarote, with a budget of ¬£600,000 for the UK and ¬£400,000 for the island in the Canaries

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp scours the south coast for Jo, Kev and their 15-year-old daughter Cody, who was born with cerebral palsy. The family hope to find a home that Cody can live in long term, so it will need space for a hydrotherapy pool, physio room and annexes for potential future carers. But with so much to consider, can they all agree on just one house? Phil Spencer helps Alice and Jack, first-time buyers who want a home within walking space of the sea

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer catches up with househunters who were keen to fly the nest. In 2017, Chloe was looking to move out of her parental home and find her own slice of Reading. But Chloe's dad, who was helping with funds, had his own idea of what kind of place his daughter should buy, which didn't align with her own thoughts. In 2019, Ella and Grant were looking for their own place to start their lives together. But as Phil soon realised, Grant seemed nervous about moving out of his mum's house

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Solicitor Allison Hampshire hosts the first dinner party from Portsmouth, focusing on a sophisticated menu and quirky entertainment that she hopes will win her the ¬£1,000 prize. Her guests are sociology lecturer William Dixon, counter manager Rose Proenca, adult tutor Kathy Anderson and actor Christopher Marlowe

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Sociology lecturer Will Dixon hosts the second dinner party in Portsmouth. His soggy salad starter fails to impress Rose Proenca, and his over-cooked beef Wellington gets an even worse reception from the rest of his guests, but surprise entertainment helps him win back a few points

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Tutor Kathy Anderson hosts the third dinner party from Portsmouth and hopes to impress her guests with a Gallic-inspired menu. But all does not go to plan in the kitchen when she experiences a near-disaster with a pineapple, and later in the evening her French entertainment raises quite a few eyebrows

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Stage actor Christopher Marlowe plays host in the fourth dinner party from Portsmouth, and tries to woo his guests with an adventurous menu and theatrical entertainment - including a one-man play involving a drunken waiter, which has a messy outcome

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Brazilian beauty-counter manager Rose Proenca hosts the final dinner party in Portsmouth, hoping her Turkish-themed menu will impress the other contestants. However, the entertainment is not to everyone's taste

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Brigitte Tee, who runs four-star B&B Gorse Meadow in the New Forest, hosts the first round of the competition. Her guests are initially charmed by her eccentric personality, but the discovery of a bathroom window in need of repair and another room containing ladybirds, cobwebs and dust soon takes the shine off their stay

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants head to Lynton in north Devon, where they stay at Alistair and Emma Mundell's four-star Castle Hill Guesthouse. The pair only opened the B&B three months prior to the competition, and hope to impress with their recently renovated rooms, but Brigitte Tee proves hard to win over. Two of their guests are also forced to overcome their fears during a trip on a Victorian cliff railway

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition moves north to Blackpool and the three-star Vidella B&B run by John Downer and Neil Williams. The pair rig Blackpool-hater Alistair Mundell's room with practical jokes, and take their guests to Funny Girls drag cabaret bar, where Mark Crib confesses he has never had such a surreal time

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Entrepreneur Mark Crib welcomes the group to the Urban Beach in Bournemouth, Dorset, for the week's final B&B visit. The boutique establishment features chic rooms with deluxe bathrooms, and the guests approve of the afternoon's activity - a speedboat ride along the Jurassic coast

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to discover how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers and to air their grievances. Brigitte Tee is upset to discover she has been given only one point for cleanliness and a heated exchange results in a walk-out, before the winner is announced

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: Air ambulance crew members take drastic steps to reset a patient's dangerously fast heartbeat, a cyclist crashes in a remote area, and a motorist is injured in a road accident

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The documentary charting the work of staff at St George's A&E continues, this time focusing on the stories of patients whose friendships have seen them through good times and bad. Phil, a 60-year-old bricklayer, is rushed in after suffering multiple injuries following a short fall from a ladder at work, and his business partner Paul discusses how the pair bonded over the course of 28 years. Meanwhile, 93-year-old widow Violet arrives after fracturing her leg while preparing to go out for lunch with the friends who have supported her since the death of her husband, and 18-year-old dance student Shiana comes to A&E with her mother and her best friend, after injuring her ankle during a rehearsal

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Cameras follow couples as they cope with treatment, including Corey, who's 27. He is rushed to St George's after suffering a cardiac arrest during a game of ice hockey, and his wife of seven days, Alice, was watching him play when he collapsed. There's also a profile of John, 55. He fell 10 feet while taking down scaffolding at home, and his spouse Penny talks about how he has supported her through sickness and bereavement during their marriage

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy words-and-numbers quiz, with Lee Mack and Victoria Coren Mitchell taking on Alan Carr and Dane Baptiste. Sam Simmons joins Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown

Phil, a 60-year-old bricklayer, is rushed in after suffering multiple injuries following a short fall from a ladder at work, and his business partner Paul discusses how the pair bonded over the course of 28 years. programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt reveals the sweet secret to iced writing on supermarket birthday cakes, and Jimmy Doherty jets to Japan to establish why soy is in so many of the UK's favourite foods, also learning how this little bean could be health-enhancing. Kate Quilton looks at the growing trend of hemp-based food products

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: Architect George Clarke recalls the impressive works of engineering people have achieved with their vehicles - from the scrap Learjet turned into a luxury garden studio to the restoration of the only surviving British mobile cinema truck. Plus, the 1950s railway carriage that was converted into a three-bedroom home and an incredibly stylish custom-designed jeep transformed into a cocktail bar

programme.title: Ugly House to Lovely House with George Clarke
programme.desc: George is joined by leading architects to help transform some of Britain's most unloved houses into desirable properties. The team meet Simon and Lisa, who recently bought a building in rural Gloucestershire in such a shoddy state that neighbours compared it to the house in Amityville Horror. George teams the couple up with creative architect Laura Clark, who attempts to turn this terrifying building into a warm and welcoming, modern home, whilst retaining some of its original character

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc: George Clarke meets single father Rick, whose four-storey terrace in Stratford-upon-Avon has just one room per floor and is totally impractical when his children come to stay. Can the architect come up with a clever redesign to create space and much-needed character? He also helps single mum Donna in Hastings, whose Victorian double reception room has not been touched for 50 years

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Salesman Richard Massey hosts the first party in Colchester, hoping his cheeky-chappy demeanour and signature dish Drunken Duck will be enough to see him walk away with the ¬£1,000 prize at the end of the week-long competition

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: PR worker Darius G Laws hosts the second dinner party in Colchester, but knows he will have to work hard after being critical the previous evening. programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: American army wife Adrena Austin hosts the third dinner party in Colchester. She hopes her simple menu, which revisits her Armenian heritage, will be a welcome change for her guests, but while reactions to the main course are mixed, her entertainment proves a resounding success

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: James Coe throws the fourth party in Colchester, and his choice of menu proves popular from the starter onwards. However, Jodie Ezekiel finds his incessant discussion of money somewhat off-putting. Fortunately, the prospect of a dip in the host's hot tub improves moods, and gives Darius G Laws a chance to show off his pink pants

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Vegetarian Jodie Edzekiel hosts the final dinner party in Colchester, and tries to please her guests by serving them meat, provided she can bring herself to touch it. When Jodie's planned entertainment lets her down, she hopes a sing-a-long with her accompanying on the organ will save the day

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Jon and Julia Shorrock host the first round of the B&B competition from their four-star Derwent House in West Sussex. The guests are split by gender to sample the area, with the men firing machine guns at a shooting range and the women relaxing at a spa - but a carpeted bathroom and shower without hot water raise questions

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Peter and Sharron Sorsky invite their fellow competitors to Kirkby Park B&B in Liverpool, but the presence of a security camera on the outside of the house leaves one guest feeling uneasy. Room inspections uncover all manner of unsightly problems, but a tour of nearby Knowsley Safari Park gives the contestants a chance to enjoy themselves

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Andy and Julian Banner-Price host the competition at their expensive B&B Plas Dinas Country House in Snowdonia, giving their new guests the priciest rooms. Peter and Sharron Sorsky are still reeling from their feedback forms and immediately find fault with the accommodation, and the group is taken to wash bedding the old-fashioned way at the local slate museum

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Annette McAnespie welcomes the group to Hazelwood Farm in Crayke, North Yorkshire, for the final B&B visit. The initial impressions are favourable and Peter and Jon begin to bond for the first time during a mosaic class, but not everyone feels up to the planned activity of a cycling tour

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time at Annette McAnespie's farm in Crayke, North Yorkshire, to discover how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers and to air their grievances, before the week's winner is announced

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Health-conscious grandmother Tina Ainsworth hosts the first dinner party in Mansfield, Nottinghamshire, putting on a Chinese-themed evening for her guests - croupier Tomasz Wisniewski, PR consultant Julia Smith, copy writer Rachel Imms and DJ Gareth Harding

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Croupier Tomasz Wisniewski hosts the second dinner party in Mansfield, Nottinghamshire. His 'outrageous'-themed evening leaves plenty of scope for his guests' imaginations, but his balloon-pumping competition brings out the competitive streak in one contestant

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: DJ Gareth Harding hosts the third dinner party from Mansfield, Nottinghamshire, where he provides an Ibiza-themed night after he transforms his garden into a Balearic cocktail bar and club complete with lasers and disco lights. The guests seem impressed with the host's sophisticated menu, but he may have bitten off more than he can chew as he attempts to cook a tricky beef Wellington

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Animal lover Rachel Imms hosts the fourth party of the week from Mansfield. She opts for a French-themed evening, but her complicated main course proves to be a challenge, and her accordionist entertainer does not appeal to everyone in the way she had hoped

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dance fanatic Julia Smith hosts the final party in Mansfield, Nottinghamshire, and is confident she will wow fellow competitors with her fancy house and hospitality, having roped in two waiters to give the evening a touch of class. A spot of salsa dancing proves entertaining for all the wrong reasons, and as the event draws to a close, the contestants gather to discover which dinner was rated the best

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Stephan, 39, is rushed to St George's with internal bleeding from his femoral artery, caused by complications following an angiogram he had the day before, and doctors are concerned his heart could be under potentially fatal strain. Nineteen-year-old Emmanuel Jr arrives in A&E after suffering an acute sickle cell crisis, and his mum Elizabeth talks about the impact the condition has had on the family, while 40-year-old Fernanda is admitted with abdominal pain, but the test results reveal a surprising reason for her discomfort

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Paramedics treat a man who is high on drugs and has been found by police sitting in a doorway with a badly broken arm. A first day at work ends badly for a member of security staff at a nightclub, as he moves awkwardly and dislocates his knee. A man who's on blood thinners falls off his mobility scooter and hits his head. With the risk of a bleed on the brain, he needs to go to hospital

programme.title: The Good Doctor
programme.desc: Shaun attends his first full day at St Bonaventure Hospital, although the attention to detail that comes with his autism throws a few spanners into the works

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: The medics race to patients injured on beaches and rivers. A boating accident on the Norfolk Broads leaves holiday-maker Carol with a partially amputated foot, and 15-year-old Robbie needs urgent care when he falls from a coastal cliff in South Shields

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty journeys to Japan to unleash the power of wasabi, Matt Tebbutt finds out which foods generate the most wind, and Kate Quilton asks if there is there really any difference between dog and cat food

programme.title: Kirstie's House of Craft
programme.desc: Reality TV star Sam Thompson and TV personality Debbie McGee test their craft skills with pretty marbled clay napkin rings

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Hertfordshire couple Phil and Geraldine can't wait to retire and spend more time with their six children and grandchildren. To kick-start this next phase of their life they want a new place to call home. However, while Phil wants to live in beautiful east Devon, Geraldine has fallen for the Gallic charm of Bergerac in the south of France. Jonnie Irwin flies the flag for the UK by showing Phil and Geraldine three properties in east Devon for their UK budget of ¬£375,000, while Jasmine Harman reveals the best Bergerac can offer for their away budget of ¬£275,000

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A straight-talking hairdresser from London tries to cut it as Costa Blanca's newest stylist and newlyweds start a new life as holiday hosts in the south of France

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien turn an old, unloved filing cabinet into a valuable and desirable storage unit and convert a Bakelite voltmeter into a retro Bluetooth speaker

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien search for more gems hidden among unwanted possessions, trying to make a profit from church organ pipes and old leather sports car seats

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate researchers look for an heir to the estate of a man with links to 19th-century South Africa, while other members of the team search for the brother of a former Birmingham resident. Plus, details of unclaimed estates where heirs are yet to be found

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The sports car-themed PitStop in Hertfordshire hosts the first round, as owners Melvyn and Sindy Rutter try to make a good impression. However, the absence of tea and coffee in the rooms does not go down well with the guests, and Melvyn's after-dinner talk about his collection of Morgan cars fails to spark much interest

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Gill and Peter Tydie invite their fellow competitors to stay at the Victory in Mersea, Essex, a four-star B&B with 26 members of staff to run the bar, restaurant and accommodation. A trip to a local fishery gives one contestant an opportunity to annoy his peers, and the discovery of a hole in a bedsheet leaves the hosts feeling uneasy about their chances of success

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Dave Botha hosts at his Butterfly Paragliding B&B on the Isle of Wight. Deborah Morrison and Wayne Bingham are unhappy they must sleep in a tepee in the garden and use an outdoor toilet, and claim they were served watery eggs and rubbery sausages for breakfast

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Deborah Morrison and Wayne Bingham host the final night at Braddon Hall in Torquay, Devon, where Melvyn and Sindy take issue with their squeaky four-poster bed. The hoteliers try to entertain their guests by inviting them to take part in an archery contest - which ends in accusations of unfair play

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to discover how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers and to air their grievances. One of the hosts gets upset about large underpayments and a couple interrogate their guests about the criticism in their feedback, before the winner is announced

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Phil Spencer travels back to Cambridgeshire to catch up with a couple he and Kirstie Allsopp first met three years ago when they were struggling with what to do with their three-bed semi. Amber Brammah, who was leading fitness classes from the garage, wanted a new house with more room to run her business, while ecologist husband Martin preferred the idea of renovating. Having made their decision, how have things changed in the 36 months since?

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Matt and Lucia's house in Royal Wootton Bassett, Wiltshire, is bulging at the seams, as it is home to not only them but three grown-up children from previous relationships. Matt loves it but Lucia does not, so while Kirstie Allsopp tries to change the layout, Phil Spencer finds some alternative properties. But will the family choose to up sticks or stay where they are?

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau: DIY
programme.desc: Tim battles to get a fence built for their marauding flock of 25 sheep, and Krys battles to balance the books. They race to get their chateau ready for their first paying guests as Lee struggles with a chandelier. Elaine and David continue the search for their dream property, visiting a 17th-century ex-priory in Normandy and taking on board all that Dick has taught them

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Professional deep-sea diver Adrian Corrigall and his wife Megan plan to build their new family home in rural East Sussex almost entirely out of concrete, with construction involving cutting-edge technologies conceived in Switzerland and never used to build a house before. However, the perils of being a pioneer soon become evident, and with both schedule and budget under strain, Adrian is forced to resume work as a diver, taking him away from the project for a month at a time

programme.title: Britain's Most Luxurious Train Journeys
programme.desc: A guide to luxury train rides across Britain, beginning with the steam-hauled Saphos train on the Devonshire coast. Train manager Sandra and her hospitality team help a passenger surprise his wife of 40 years with a special anniversary present, while executive chef Nick creates a sumptuous five-course meal and learner steam train driver Ian clocks up more training hours passing alongside the red rock coast

programme.title: The Secret World of...
programme.desc: Dawn French narrates a look at some of the fiercest rivalries between British chocolate bar manufacturers, revealing the lengths companies went to in a bid to make their product the nation's favourite. Featuring contributions from the brains behind the brands

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Michelle, who's 54, is airlifted to St George's after being involved in a car crash with her husband Paul in Surrey. She was given a blood transfusion at the scene and doctors work quickly to get her to CT to ascertain the full extent of her injuries. Cameras also follow Derren, 41, who has fractured his ankle while trampolining with his 12-year-old daughter, Macie

programme.desc: A flash property developer wants his AMG Mercedes C63 customised to match his Porsche, Bentley and Range Rover, which have all already been wrapped in gold

programme.title: Yianni: Supercar Customiser

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May are sent to Bolivia, where they are challenged to travel through the rainforest and journey to the coast of Chile, driving second-hand off-road vehicles bought locally for a maximum of ¬£3,500 each. Along the way, they encounter drug lords and feel the effects of altitude sickness as they negotiate the region's roads, one of which is a notoriously dangerous 40-mile mountain pass dubbed El Camino de la Muerte - the Death Road

programme.title: Australian Ninja Warrior
programme.desc: Only the fittest and the fastest Ninja Warriors will survive as they take to the Grand Final course and race against the clock

programme.desc: Rick explores the Fowey Estuary, one of Cornwall's hidden secrets, joining a friend on a boat trip to learn about the history of the area and getting a unique view of the buildings along the riverbank. He discovers the area's history of piracy, meets a family that make award-winning vodka, and makes a pancake with a wild blackberry compote and Cornish clotted cream

programme.title: Top Gear

Along the way they must negotiate salt pans, rivers and reserves full of animals while facing sweltering heat and suffocating dust

programme.title: World's Most Dangerous Roads

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May set out to boost the British economy by embarking on a trade mission to India. Equipped with three old British cars and a range of uniquely British products, they set off on an epic road trip across one of the world's most fascinating and challenging countries, devotedly promoting Britain - with distinctly mixed results

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?

Joining team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are comedians Rhod Gilbert and Hal Cruttenden, interior designer and former Dragons' Den investor Kelly Hoppen and TV host and number-cruncher Carol Vorderman

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee and Lucy pop out on a last-minute Christmas Eve mission, leaving their youngsters in the apparently capable hands of Geoffrey - cutting more of a strict and stuffy Victorian gent than usual - and wife Wendy. Alas, things don't quite go to plan for the outward-bound duo, as a theft and unexpected trip into deep countryside await. Not only that, but there are encounters with an aggressive bull in a field and a terrifying truck driver to endure. Meanwhile, back at home, Lee's lovably feckless father Frank turns up to offer gifts - in his own inimitable way. Lee Mack, Sally Bretton and Bobby Ball star

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee and Lucy plan some New Year's Eve festivities in this Christmas special, with both inviting their parents to join them. Things soon go badly wrong as party games give way to an uncompromising round of guests pointing out what New Year's resolutions everyone needs to make - with a distinct lack of festive spirit on display. Starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton

programme.title: We Are Not Alone
programme.desc: Stewart's plan to boost alien popularity via social media goes awry - in doing so, he attracts attention from anti-alien resistance fighters who tap into Stewart as a potential mole.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended edition. programme.desc: The couple have their first lovers' tiff and Gavin is so beside himself with worry he drives all the way to Barry Island to resolve things. programme.desc: The bride-to-be goes on a hen party, while Gavin embarks on two stag nights, the second of which reveals shocking secrets about his fiancee that could jeopardise the wedding. programme.title: James May's Cars of the People
programme.desc: James concludes his examination of the social significance of cars by exploring how aspiration and new wealth were behind the development of some of the greatest models ever made. He tries to make sense of the baffling world of company car hierarchy by holding a travelling salesman race-off and indulges his 1980s urges with the twin delights of a Lamborghini and a Porsche. He also unveils his choice of the ultimate people's car - a vehicle that can lay claim to being the greatest in history

programme.title: Building Cars: Secrets of the Assembly Line
programme.desc: James makes friends with an army of diligent robots, Kate sees if she has what it takes to work on the assembly line, and Ant explores the story of one of the most iconic cars ever.

programme.title: World's Most Dangerous Roads
programme.desc: Celebrities undertake journeys on some of the most perilous routes in the world. In Alaska, Sue Perkins and Charley Boorman drive along the notorious Dalton Highway, a dirt track originally constructed in the 1970s as a supply road for the Trans-Alaska oil pipeline. The pair struggle to cope with the Arctic conditions and constant threat of avalanches, but receive help from experienced truckers who teach them some unwritten rules for surviving the road's many hazards

programme.title: Taskmaster

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo leaves Europe behind to take in the sights, smells and tastes of North Africa as he travels from the Mediterranean port of Tangier to the Berber city of Marrakech. At Asilah, the political commentator lends a hand with the construction of Morocco's new ¬£3billion high-speed railway line to Casablanca, where he calls in to the most famous gin joint in the world

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from the Italian Riviera to the Austrian Alps, starting in Genoa, where he learns how an Edwardian Briton introduced football to the port. He takes the train as it clings to the cliffs along the Riviera Di Levanti to reach the picturesque and remote villages of the Cinque Terre, now a UNESCO World Heritage Site, before ending his journey in the famous Brenner Pass, the scene of a ground-breaking engineering project to build one of the world's longest rail tunnels

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo braves the freezing temperatures of the Baltic Sea and finds peace paddling a canoe on the Lakes of Finland. On his journey from the Latvian capital Riga to Tampere in Finland, he encounters medieval knights in Tallinn, grills sausages in Helsinki and samples cloudberry liqueur in a hot tub. He later arrives in Estonia, where in the setting of a ruined 13th-century cathedral he learns how the Baltic countries demonstrated their desire for independence from the Soviet Union with a 'singing revolution'

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo concludes his journey in the Netherlands, where he travels from Rotterdam to Utrecht, including a visit to the world's largest flower auction in Haarlem, a trip to Delft to learn how the city came to specialise in pottery and an exploration of the government buildings in The Hague

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo takes in Georgia and Azerbaijan as he journeys through the former Russian empire. He begins in the port of Batumi, discovers a surprise 19th-century tea plantation in the West Georgian countryside, visits a private museum dedicated to Joseph Stalin - the most infamous Georgian of all - and discovers that a Briton was the first to conquer the highest mountain in the Caucasus range. Arriving in Azerbaijan, he learns about its role in the 19th-century oil industry

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo examines the history of the American rail network, using Appleton's General Guide to the United States and Canada of 1879 to plot his course. He begins on Manhattan Island and travels from Grand Central Terminal to the site of Ground Zero

programme.desc: Acclaimed chronicle of the Second World War, beginning with an account of Hitler's ascent to power at a time when the Germans were stricken by humiliating military defeat, runaway inflation and economic depression. The Nazi leader's promises of regained national pride and prosperity struck a chord with millions of ordinary citizens, and he was elected on a tidal wave of popular support. Narrated by Laurence Olivier

However, Columbo sees through his hi-tech ruse and tries to expose the truth. Crime drama, starring Peter Falk, Oskar Werner and Gena Rowlands

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: A wealthy man due to marry a younger woman is electrocuted in the bath. Columbo suspects the victim's identical twin nephews - a flamboyant TV chef and a conservative banker - who stand to inherit his fortune if he died unmarried, but the detective is unsure which of them is the guilty party. Drama, starring Peter Falk, and Martin Landau in a dual role. With Paul Stewart, Julie Newmar and Jeanette Nolan

programme.title: Murder in the First
programme.desc: The inspectors search for ways to link the suspects to the Cindy Strauss's murder, while Hildy is confronted by a young witness in a past case who is worried for his mother's safety after she is physically abused by her new husband. Starring Taye Diggs, Kathleen Robertson and Tom Felton

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A suspect in the murder of a Mob lawyer's wife dies while being restrained by Stabler, who maintains he did nothing wrong. Unfortunately for him, the evidence contradicts his protestations of innocence, and he finds himself suspended and facing charges of causing death by using excessive force. Drama, guest starring Cary Elwes (The Princess Bride, Saw), with Christopher Meloni

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A mother is accused of killing her missing one-year-old baby, and becomes so distraught that she commits suicide. The ensuing investigation proves harrowing, and takes a heavy emotional toll on Benson, who is forced to confront questions about her own family history as the case unfolds. Guest starring Pablo Schreiber (The Wire)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Stabler and Beck arrest a homeless man on suspicion of the rape and murder of a woman and her 10-year-old daughter - only to find he is actually Munch's estranged uncle Andrew (guest star Jerry Lewis). As the case proceeds, a new suspect is identified, but the evidence against him is thrown out in court - and events build to a tragic conclusion. Drama, starring Christopher Meloni and Connie Nielsen

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A rapist begins to escalate his crimes, attacking victims more than once - and Dr Huang suspects he has a particularly disturbing motive for targeting them. However, tensions flare between Stabler and Beck as they make a difficult decision to help catch whoever is responsible. Crime drama, starring Christopher Meloni, Mariska Hargitay and Dann Florek

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The team investigates when a council official is accused of rape by a fellow worker and claims the alleged attacker demanded sex in return for a career promotion. Award-winning police drama, starring Christopher Noth and Jerry Orbach

programme.title: Lucifer
programme.desc: When a movie star's son is killed after being chased by the paparazzi, Chloe takes a deep look into the case with a little help from Lucifer

programme.title: 999: Criminals Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Footage of offences in the UK recorded on CCTV, revealing how it is being used by police forces to solve major crimes across Britain. The programme shows how CCTV helped detectives track down three men wanted for attempted murder outside a nightclub, and how it recorded a brazen cash machine gang who used explosives to conduct a reign of terror

Gibbs and the team are given the task of protecting the politician's daughter while she studies in America, but fail to stop her being kidnapped and ransomed in a bid to prevent her father signing an important treaty. Crime drama, starring Sean Murray and Michael Weatherly

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A marine's teeth and fingertips are found in a pickpocket's stolen purse, and Ducky discovers he had been tortured on a rack before dying. The agents realise he may have been killed in error, and that the real target was his ex-girlfriend, a skilled player of computer games who unwittingly uncovered a mysterious code. Crime drama, starring Michael Weatherly and Sean Murray

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The agents learn one of their former investigative assistants has been murdered, and had been selling information about how to rob a warehouse full of valuable possessions belonging to a woman convicted of fraud. As the case proceeds, Tony becomes infatuated with the new leader of another team, who apparently returns his feelings. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Michael Weatherly

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A woman is shot in her sleep, and further investigation leads the detectives to a boy whose drug-addicted mother has placed him in the care of her dealer. Crime drama, starring Jerry Orbach

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A college student is found dead, prompting the detective duo to search for a rapist on campus. However, a report from the medical examiner puts them on a different path, and they discover events may have gone down an even more sinister track

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A woman is murdered during an apparent road-rage incident, and the officers unravel a conspiracy involving arson. American crime drama starring Sam Waterston

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The officers leap into action when a financial planner is killed in her apartment building. It soon becomes apparent that the culprit could be a hit-man who was intending to murder someone else who happened to resemble the victim. Crime drama, starring Sam Waterston and Jerry Orbach

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The squad investigates when a wealthy man is found murdered, and discover his family were all striving to get their hands on the inheritance. Sam Waterston stars

programme.title: NCIS

When another man is found dead nearby, the NCIS team begins to suspect a serial killer is on the loose. Meanwhile, Ducky introduces Gibbs to his new girlfriend. Crime drama, guest starring Cheryl Ladd

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Homeland Security employee Victor Sterling mysteriously disappears and his car is found at a drive-through restaurant that becomes the scene of a double murder. To complicate matters further, the missing man's outspoken spouse happens to be the ex-wife of both Gibbs and Fornell. American naval crime drama, starring Mark Harmon, Joe Spano, Tom Gallop and Melinda McGraw

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part one of two. A military aircraft transporting the bodies of dead US marines back home crashes before reaching its destination, and Gibbs and the team are called in to help identify human remains at the site of the wreckage. However, a DNA discrepancy turns a routine investigation into a search for a missing person. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon

programme.title: NCIS

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit

Crime drama, starring Mariska Hargitay

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The discovery of a murdered man in a graveyard leads Munch to discover he was a rent boy, who had recently made calls to a church known for its notorious anti-gay beliefs. The institution's founder confesses to the crime as the evidence mounts against him, but the detectives suspect he is taking the blame for someone else. Crime drama, starring Richard Belzer

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A distinctive tattoo on the body of a dead teenage girl leads Stabler and Beck to a foster home - which proves to be a cover for a child-prostitution ring. programme.title: Motorway Patrol
programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series is centred around the roads of Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. There is also footage of drivers falling asleep at the wheel, overloaded vehicles and suspects caught with illegal substances - plus a host of excuses as the people pulled over try to persuade officers they have not done anything wrong

programme.desc: Part two of two. The crew continues its attempts to prevent a leading 20th-century industrialist from destroying the future. programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The team's efforts to track down 900lbs of stolen explosives are stalled when a bomb goes off in the city. The amount used still leaves the unknown terrorists with enough high explosive to level a large portion of the city. When Russo reveals Homeland Security knew the attack was orchestrated by a gang of South African mercenaries, Brody is forced to question what her new lover's real agenda might be. The situation becomes even more awkward when it becomes clear Russo has been involved in a string of cases that resulted in mysterious fatalities. While Pride and Sonja head out in search of the remaining explosives, Brody works together with Patton and Sebastian to investigate her new boyfriend's credentials. Naval crime drama, guest starring Ivan Sergei

programme.title: Grimm
programme.desc: Nick and Hank investigate when a child goes missing, uncovering several similar cases all linked by sightings of a mysterious ghostly presence. It transpires that the Weeping Woman - or La Llorona - is a ghost who kidnaps three children every Halloween and drowns them, hoping their sacrifice can atone for the loss of her own children, whom she also drowned. David Giuntoli stars

programme.title: Cranford
programme.desc: Conclusion of the two-part special. The women of Cranford are excited about the imminent visit of Lady Glenmire, until the Hon Mrs Jamieson announces that none of them is of high enough social standing to meet her - so Miss Matty leads the Amazons in snubbing both the newcomer and her hostess. But sociable Lady Glenmire is quick to offer an olive branch by hosting a memorable Halloween party, which results in the forging of new friendships. Mr Buxton is impressed by Edward Bell's ambitions, so takes him on as land agent, only for the new employee to make a disastrous decision that has dire consequences for both himself and his sister Peggy. Meanwhile, Matty is distressed when a surprising discovery about one of her close circle results in a serious falling out among the friends, and when tragedy strikes the town, she fears Cranford may never recover. Judi Dench, Celia Imrie and Jonathan Pryce star

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing lesser known areas of London for locals and tourists. Featuring Lee, Bermondsey and Stratford. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: Mistresses
programme.desc: Jessica and Mark go on a romantic break to make up after a drunken argument, while Trudi starts to question her future with Richard after discovering the reality of his estranged wife's situation. Siobhan encourages Hari to open a restaurant so she can quit her job - which she thinks is the perfect way to get their marriage back on track

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh returns with the celebrity version of the team quiz show. As ever, four star contestants are challenged to pit their wits against one of the show's ruthless quiz experts, in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds for their charity of choice.
